gw.processes

Class BatchProcessBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.MultiPhaseBatchProcess
      • com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.SinglePhaseBatchProcess
        • gw.processes.BatchProcessBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BatchProcess

    public abstract class BatchProcessBase
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.SinglePhaseBatchProcess
    This class represents a base class for customer written batch processes. Other artifacts that need to be created along with this implementation

    A new BatchProcessType.xml entry for this batch process after making this change be sure to execute ant scheduler-config-xsd

    Your IProcessesPlugin.createBatchProcess(gw.pl.batchprocessing.typekey.BatchProcessType, java.lang.Object[]) must have an entry for this.

    Implementation notes:

    You must implement a constructor

    You may want either an argumentless constructor or one that takes an array of objects that can be passed by IMaintenanceAPI

    You must implement doWork.

    This does not yet have a transaction. If you need a transaction (and bundle) use Transaction.runWithNewBundle(gw.transaction.Transaction.BlockRunnable)

    This should check TerminateRequested and exit if set

    This should use incrementOperationsCompleted() and incrementOperationsFailed()

    You probably want to implement checkInitialConditions, to set OperationsExpected

    If you accept arguments you may want to override Exclusive, so multiple of this batch process can be run.

    If you are going to ignore TerminateRequested, override terminate() to return false

    Author:
    dandrews

    • Constructor Detail

      • BatchProcessBase

        protected BatchProcessBase(BatchProcessType batchProcessType)
        This will create a new batch process for the specified batch process type. Implementation Note: A subclass constructor typically have no parameters or an array of objects as parameters. The array will be supplied across the IMaintenanceTool and therefore should be simple types like string.
        Parameters:
        batchProcessType - the specific batch process type

    • Method Detail

      • doWork

        protected abstract void doWork()
        This method must be implemented. It performs the work desired in the batch. This method does not have a bundle, so use Transaction.runWithNewBundle(gw.transaction.Transaction.BlockRunnable) to obtain a bundle. It should also check TerminateRequested periodically to insure that it is okay to continue.
        Specified by:
        doWork in class com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.SinglePhaseBatchProcess

      • setChunkingById

        public final void setChunkingById(IQueryResult queryResult,
                   int chunkingSize)
        This will change the result set to do chunking, and the most efficient way of doing this is by Id. Do not sort the results as this will add a sort by id. This has no effect on your code (you still just iterate over the results), but will dramatically improve the performance on large result sets.
        Parameters:
        queryResult - The result of the query
        chunkingSize - the number of rows to return in each chunk.

      • getDescription

        protected java.lang.String getDescription()
        This will return a description for this specific batch process, it normally only needs to be overridden to report the arguments passed in the constructor.

        getDescription in class com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.SinglePhaseBatchProcess
